segments.content: Written by
Roland Emmerich & Harald Kloser
Second Draft
OVER BLACK We listen to the immortal music of Mozart's Adagio of the Clarinet Concerto in A.

dialogue.text: OVER BLACK We listen to the immortal music of Mozart's Adagio of the Clarinet Concerto in A.

segments.content:
Space, infinite and empty.

          But then, slowly all nine planets of our Solar System move

          into frame and align.

          The last of them is the giant, burning sphere of the sun.

          Just as the sun enters frame, a solar storm of gigantic

          proportion unfolds. The eruptions shoot thousands of miles

          into the blackness of space.

Mozart's concerto filters from a jeep's stereo, fighting the

          drumming sounds of the monsoon rain. PROF. FREDERIC WEST, 66,

          listens to the music.

          An Indian BOY playing by the roadside steers his wooden toy

          ship across a puddle.

          The Professor turns to his driver, pointing to the boy.

But it's too late. The jeep drives straight through the puddle at full speed, sinking the boy's toy ship. In the background, the jeep stops in front of a building. The driver jumps out, leading the Professor towards its entrance. The sign at the door reads: `Institute for Astrophysics - University of New Delhi'.

dialogue.text: But it's too late. The jeep drives straight through the puddle at full speed, sinking the boy's toy ship. In the background, the jeep stops in front of a building. The driver jumps out, leading the Professor towards its entrance. The sign at the door reads: `Institute for Astrophysics - University of New Delhi'.

segments.content:
An endless mine shaft. An old elevator cage comes to a

          grinding halt. When Prof. West steps out we see that he is

          accompanied now by a nervous DR. SATNAM TSURUTANI, 32.
How deep are we?
8200 feet. Used to be an old copper
mine, Professor, sir.
As Prof. West follows Satnam, he takes in the unusual setting
for this science lab.
Helmsley told me that the neutrino
count doubled during the last sun
eruptions.
Correct, sir. But that is not what
worries me...
They enter a large room with low hanging ceilings. A small
group of WHITE COATS look up from their computers, which all
show images of the solar storm we witnessed earlier.
There was a new solar storm, so strong
that the physical reaction got even
more severe.
How can that be?
Satnam walks over into another room. There he opens a hatch on the floor and hot steam rises.

dialogue.text: Satnam walks over into another room. There he opens a hatch on the floor and hot steam rises.

segments.content: The neutrinos suddenly act like...
microwaves.
Prof. West slowly steps closer. When he discovers that the
water in the tank below is boiling, his face goes pale.

A major fund raising party is under way. The setting is

          spectacular. A terrace overlooking the Washington Mall and

          the Capitol Building.

          ADRIAN HELMSLEY, 32, stands with a group of young POLITICAL

          AIDES. He is the only African-American among them.

          One of the aides spots CARL ANHEUSER, 58, White House Chief

          of Staff, working the crowd.
Look at Anheuser. Anyone would think he
was President. Did you hear, he wants
us to sign in and out like school boys?
I still can't believe that Wilson chose
him of all people to run the White
House.
Why not? Anheuser owns the Senate and
the Congress.
Shame he's such a pompous ass.
Adrian turns to see Anheuser smiling.

dialogue.text: Adrian turns to see Anheuser smiling.

segments.content: Yes sir... No, sir.
Which one is it?
We were talking about what a great
speech you gave tonight. Well done,
sir.
It's Helmsley, right? I'll remember
that.
Anheuser walks away with a dangerous smile.
At that moment Adrian's cell phone rings.

character.name: That guy scares the shit out of me.

dialogue.text: At that moment Adrian's cell phone rings.

segments.content: (into the phone)
Professor West?
INT. LIVING ROOM/SATNAM'S HOUSE - NIGHT Prof. West is on the phone. In the background we make out Satnam's family around the dining room table.

character.name: I've been trying to reach you!

dialogue.text: INT. LIVING ROOM/SATNAM'S HOUSE - NIGHT Prof. West is on the phone. In the background we make out Satnam's family around the dining room table.

segments.content: Listen, Adrian. The situation is much
worse than we thought...
Satnam quiets his little son. It is the boy we saw earlier
with his toy ship.

Adrian follows Anheuser through a hallway of the White House,

          papers in hand.
Sir, the President needs to know this.
Helmsley, how long have you been on the
job as science advisor?
Four months this week.
I would   say that's enough time to learn
that we   have rules here. You'll just
have to   wait until the quarterly
science   briefing.
If this is about what I said last
night, I am truly sorry, sir.
Exasperated, Adrian holds out the papers to him.

character.name: So you didn't like my speech?

dialogue.text: Exasperated, Adrian holds out the papers to him.

segments.content: Can you please have a look at this,
sir? It's really important.
Finally, Anheuser rips the papers out of his hands and starts
to walk away, reading.
Suddenly he slows down.
Who wrote this?
An Indian astrophysicist I graduated
with from Harvard and Prof. West, the
preeminent geologist in the US.
Who else knows about it?
No one, sir.
Anheuser walks away.

character.name: Let's keep it that way, Helmsley.

dialogue.text: Anheuser walks away.

segments.content:
G8 Summit. Riot police control the unruly crowd with water

          cannons.

          We see PROTESTERS with Anti Globalization signs behind a

          fence. A convoy of limousines is approaching a historic

          building.

We follow the American delegation into the conference room,

          where the other G8 delegations are seated around an enormous

          table.

          The President of the United States, THOMAS F. WILSON, 56,

          doesn't sit down. He addresses the room and everybody goes

          quiet.
For the first time we see the President's face. He is African- American.

dialogue.text: For the first time we see the President's face. He is African- American.

segments.content: I hereby present a motion to meet
privately with my seven fellow Heads of
State, kindly excluding the rest of the
delegates.
A murmur erupts. The Russian President SERGEY MAKARENKO, 62,
whispers to one of his interpreters.
Mr. Makarenko wishes to have his
interpreters present.
President Wilson looks over to the Russian Colleague.
Mr. President, judging from the
conversations we've had in the past, I
can assure you, your English is
absolutely fine, for what I have to
say.
As the Russian President waves his interpreter away, all the
international delegates leave as well.
The huge doors of the hall close. A secret service officer in
the sound booth switches off the recording equipment to the
chamber.
The President gathers himself.
Six months ago I was made aware of a
situation so devastating, that at
first, I refused to believe it.
However through the concerted efforts
of the brightest scientists of several
nations, we have now confirmed its
validity.
Dead silence.
The world as we know it, will soon come
to an end.

A huge Chinese military helicopter blasts through a majestic

          mountain valley in Tibet. We are at the top of the world.
A Chinese COLONEL, wearing dark sun glasses, watches from the
chopper as the army forces the evacuation of the villages and
monasteries.
(in Chinese)
You will have new houses, electricity
and running water...

Someone speaks on a megaphone in the village square as

          villagers are evicted by soldiers and herded into trucks.
... Some among you will even have the
chance to work for the glorious
People's Republic of China building the
biggest dam project in the world...
NENG PANG, a young monk, 18, is loaded into a truck together
with his PARENTS, both in their 60's.

Neng's older brother, LIN PANG, 25, is part of a huge crowd

          of young men and women staying behind by a Tibetan school

          building. He turns and yells after the truck.
The Colonel with the dark glasses steps up, addressing the masses.

character.name: I will send you money mother.

dialogue.text: The Colonel with the dark glasses steps up, addressing the masses.

segments.content: Eager hands fly up in the air. An official makes notes.

dialogue.text: Eager hands fly up in the air. An official makes notes.

segments.content: Lin's hand shoots up in the air. We hear a siren echoing through the mountains and suddenly an explosion. Lin turns. In the BACKGROUND, a series of explosions punch enormous holes into the side of the mountain, showering rock everywhere.

dialogue.text: Lin's hand shoots up in the air. We hear a siren echoing through the mountains and suddenly an explosion. Lin turns. In the BACKGROUND, a series of explosions punch enormous holes into the side of the mountain, showering rock everywhere.

segments.content:
A MAN in a dark suit walks through a hallway of the

          Dorchester looking like your typical MI-6 agent. The decor is

          plush and luxurious. He's stopped by two security men who

          frisk him.
Heavily ringed fingers flip through a folder.
Has his Highness had the opportunity to
study the dossier?
A SAUDI PRINCE looks up and nods without expression.
You must understand I have a very big
family. Mister...
Isaacs.
Mister Isaacs, one billion dollars is a
lot of money.
I'm afraid the amount is in Euros, your
Highness.

A group of dark figures in overalls walk past famous

          Renaissance paintings. They stop at the Mona Lisa.

          MANFRED PICARD, 63, head of the French National Museums,

          stands by LAURA, a young African-American woman in her late

          20's. They observe the specialists opening the case of the

          famous painting.

          A whoosh of air as the vacuum seal breaks.
Laura, I'm putting a lot of trust in
your people.
Laura answers in almost perfect French.
There are too many crazy people who
could hurt her, Manfred. The World
Heritage Foundation has done this all
over the world.
In the BACKGROUND the Mona Lisa is taken off the wall and
replaced with a perfect replica. Picard still looks uneasy.
He watches as the real Mona Lisa is sealed into an airtight
case.
And she'll be safe now? Tucked away in
the Swiss Alps?
Picard looks suspicious but says nothing. The CAMERA MOVES IN on the face of the fake Mona Lisa until all we see is her mysterious smile.

dialogue.text: Picard looks suspicious but says nothing. The CAMERA MOVES IN on the face of the fake Mona Lisa until all we see is her mysterious smile.

segments.content:
Lifeless bodies encircle a huge fire pit. They resemble the

          rays of the sun. In the background we see the famous step

          pyramids of Tikal.
... The mass suicide was discovered by
a BBC documentary crew in the ancient
Many of the dead are women and children looking peaceful and are surrounded by colorful flowers.

dialogue.text: Many of the dead are women and children looking peaceful and are surrounded by colorful flowers.

segments.content: ... the victims were said to have
adhered to the Mayan-Quiche Calender
which predicts the end of time to occur
on the 21st of December this year, due
to the sun's destructive forces...
The CAMERA slowly pulls out and we are in--

heading.raw_text: INT. JACKSON'S APARTMENT/LOS ANGELES - EARLY MORNING

segments.content: A shabby apartment in Silverlake. The TV is on.
... Strangely enough, scientific
records do support the fact that we are
heading for the biggest solar climax in
recorded history...
A small tremor rocks the apartment and the dishevelled face
of JACKSON CURTIS, 33, pops up from behind the couch. He fell
asleep at his laptop last night.
One look at his watch and he is off running. He throws some clothes and a toothbrush in a bag. His cell phone rings.

dialogue.text: One look at his watch and he is off running. He throws some clothes and a toothbrush in a bag. His cell phone rings.

segments.content: Hello?... What do you mean? I'm not
late. It's not even 10:30...
Jackson turns off the TV and darts towards the door, stopping
only to slide his laptop into a knapsack. As he turns, he
stumbles over a stack of books, all shrink-wrapped and
identically titled: `Farewell Atlantis'.
Damn it!
(into the phone)
Kate, I'm on my way... For god's
sake...
Frustrated, he kicks them out of his way and exits. We hold
on the books and realize that Jackson's photograph is on
their back covers.

heading.raw_text: EXT. JACKSON'S GARAGE/LOS ANGELES - EARLY MORNING

segments.content:
The phone call continues as Jackson opens the garage door,

          struggling to pack his old SUV with camping equipment.
They're kids, Kate, going on vacation.
It's not a doctor's appointment... it's
supposed to be fun. You remember that,
right? Fun?
He tries to start the engine, but the battery is dead.
Frustrated, he hits the steering wheel.

heading.raw_text: EXT. JACKSON'S STREET/LOS ANGELES - EARLY MORNING

segments.content:
Jackson runs across the street with his camping equipment,

          throwing it into the trunk of a stretch limo parked by the

          curb.
... I know it's mosquito season at
Yellowstone, Kate. I'll pick some up on
the way.
He notices a deep crack in the asphalt. His neighbors, an
elderly couple, stand there and stare at it.
Merrill, we should move back to
Jackson gets into the limo and speeds off. INT. STREETS/LOS ANGELES - EARLY MORNING Jackson drives through LA with the radio on.

dialogue.text: Jackson gets into the limo and speeds off. INT. STREETS/LOS ANGELES - EARLY MORNING Jackson drives through LA with the radio on.

segments.content: ... Those shake-proof coffee mugs are a
genius idea, and they just show the
true nature of us Californians.
We pass a family frantically loading boxes into a van.
We'll not bow to little inconveniences
like these so called `mini-quakes'...
Jackson passes a man in a wheelchair. He's holding up a
cardboard sign: `Repent - The End is Near'.
Jackson stops and honks in front of an upscale Westwood home.
... If you have a funny `mini-quake'
story you wanna share, call Lisa &
Jackson switches the radio off. Two kids NOAH, 10, and LILLY, 7, come running down the driveway. They slow down, as they see the limo.

dialogue.text: Jackson switches the radio off. Two kids NOAH, 10, and LILLY, 7, come running down the driveway. They slow down, as they see the limo.

segments.content: Jackson, what is this?
Don't call me Jackson, Noah, I'm your
father.
Lilly yells from inside the limo.
Noah! Look! Daddy's got Space-Busters
in the car... and Space-Busters 2.
Their mother, KATE CURTIS, 32, a beautiful woman appears.

dialogue.text: Their mother, KATE CURTIS, 32, a beautiful woman appears.

segments.content: So what, you're a chauffeur now? What
happened to the temp work?
This is better hours for me. Means I
can still write.
Kate's new boyfriend, GORDON SILBERMAN, 43, pulls out of the garage in his Porsche wearing his Bluetooth.

dialogue.text: Kate's new boyfriend, GORDON SILBERMAN, 43, pulls out of the garage in his Porsche wearing his Bluetooth.

segments.content: (on the phone)
Simone, how many times have I told you,
we don't do Lipo on Fridays. It's too
messy.
Jackson smiles bitterly. Gordon waves at the kids.
Have fun guys. And watch out for those
bears.
(to Jackson)
Jackson waves grudgingly as Gordon pulls away.

dialogue.text: Jackson waves grudgingly as Gordon pulls away.

segments.content: Noah needs to read twenty pages from
his book each day...
She follows Jackson to the car with a bag of pull-up diapers.
... and Lilly has to put these on,
before she goes to sleep.
Still?
He shuts the trunk and gets back behind the wheel. She looks
at him seriously.
Jackson, they've been really looking
forward to this you know. Don't let
them down.
He nods as the car pulls away.

heading.raw_text: EXT. SHIP DECK/SAN FRANCISCO HARBOR - DAY

segments.content:
HARRY HELMSLEY, 73, and his partner TONY DELGADO, 68, board

          an enormous cruise ship, the `Freedom of the Seas'. Harry is

          African-American, Tony is Italian. He carries a large case.

          They pass a poster: `Jazz Night with Harry Helmsley & Tony

          Delgado'.
So this time we'll hit the Japs.
So what?
Well Tony, electronics are cheap there
and... you could visit your boy Will.
TONY shoots a charmers smile at a couple of older single ladies on sun loungers. They smile back coyly.

dialogue.text: TONY shoots a charmers smile at a couple of older single ladies on sun loungers. They smile back coyly.

segments.content: Are you even listening to me?
Yes unfortunately I am Harry.
I heard from Audrey you're a grandpa
now.
Why don't you keep your nose out of my
family. You're cramping my style.
He married a Japanese girl - how is
that the end of the world? You should
at least go see him.
Why? Do you see your boy?
Not as much as I'd like. DC is a long
way. But at least we talk.
What about?

Suddenly they're thrown off balance by a large swell that pulls the massive `Freedom of the Seas' away from the landing, about ten yards. The next moment, the ship slams back against the dock with an earthshaking BOOM.

dialogue.text: Suddenly they're thrown off balance by a large swell that pulls the massive `Freedom of the Seas' away from the landing, about ten yards. The next moment, the ship slams back against the dock with an earthshaking BOOM.

segments.content: A murmur goes through the crowd. Luckily nobody is injured.

dialogue.text: A murmur goes through the crowd. Luckily nobody is injured.

segments.content:
The phone rings twice before Laura switches on a light. We

          catch a glimpse of a framed photo of her and Adrian. She

          answers the phone.
Laura? They lied to us.
EXT. STREETS/PARIS - NIGHT Picard is speeding in his Peugeot, anxiously checking his rear view mirror.

dialogue.text: EXT. STREETS/PARIS - NIGHT Picard is speeding in his Peugeot, anxiously checking his rear view mirror.

segments.content: I had my suspicions. I should have said
something. They are following me.
Who is?
They may be listening to us too. Laura
the Heritage Foundation is a sham.
Picard's car approaches a tunnel.
What?
The art you collected, it's not in the
The Peugeot enters a tunnel.

dialogue.text: The Peugeot enters a tunnel.

segments.content: A huge blast rips through the tunnel as his car explodes.

dialogue.text: A huge blast rips through the tunnel as his car explodes.

segments.content: (singing along to the
`We all live in a Yellow Submarine...'
They're driving through the glorious landscape of Yellowstone
National Park. Noah sits in the back with headphones on
playing Space-Busters 2.
As they pass over a ridge, the music station is overpowered
by a talk show filtering through. We hear a raspy and
excitable voice.
... After what is going on in La-La-
land with all those surface cracks, I
told myself: Get your stupid ass to
Yellowstone. I don't want to miss all
the great fun, when it finally blows...
Lilly reaches for the dial of the radio.
What happened to the music?
Hang on, sweet pea, let daddy listen to
this for a moment...
Jackson corrects the dial to get better reception.
... There's been government people
flying in and out all morning. And
trust me, they did not look happy...
A huge black helicopter brushes over the limo.
... Folks, always remember, you heard
it first from Charlie.
They watch in awe as the chopper disappears behind a ridge.

Laura bursts in and heads straight for the TV. The President

          looks up from his desk.
Sally the President's Secretary enters, flustered.

dialogue.text: Sally the President's Secretary enters, flustered.

segments.content: Sally closes the door as Laura turns up the TV.

dialogue.text: Sally closes the door as Laura turns up the TV.

segments.content: ... Mr. Picard had been the director of
the French National Museums for 24
years. As fate would have it his
assassination took place in the same
Paris tunnel where Princess Diana died
The President comes around his desk. Laura looks at him
distraught.
I just talked to him, Dad. He told me
the world Heritage Foundation is a
sham. Is that true?
The President shoots an anxious look across the room. Laura
turns and suddenly realizes that Adrian is standing in the
corner.
You knew too? You sleep with me and you
didn't say anything?
Adrian looks ashamed.
I can't even look at you. Either of
you!
Honey, calm down.
A man was killed! I want the truth Dad.
Right now.

heading.subject: TONE NATIONAL PARK
heading.raw_text: EXT. FOREST TRAIL/YELLOWSTONE NATIONAL PARK - DAY

segments.content: A dense forest trail. We hear Lilly before we see her.
Daddy, where are we going?
To a very special place, Lil'bee. It's
a lake. A place where mommy and daddy
fell in love.
(winking to Noah)
Remember the book I gave you?
I don't want to know where you and mom
had sex. I'm not ready for that,
Jackson.
I'm your dad, Noah.
Jackson runs to catch up with Lilly who has reached a fence with a `keep out' sign posted.

dialogue.text: Jackson runs to catch up with Lilly who has reached a fence with a `keep out' sign posted.

segments.content: Jackson starts to climb the fence.

dialogue.text: Jackson starts to climb the fence.

segments.content: Don't you see the signs?
EXT. RIDGE/YELLOWSTONE NATIONAL PARK - DAY Jackson and his kids crest a ridge. They look down on a parched basin with cracked terrain.

dialogue.text: EXT. RIDGE/YELLOWSTONE NATIONAL PARK - DAY Jackson and his kids crest a ridge. They look down on a parched basin with cracked terrain.

segments.content: It's gone. The whole darn lake is gone.

The kids roll their eyes. EXT. EMPTY LAKE BED/YELLOWSTONE NATIONAL PARK - DAY A puddle of water is all that remains of the lake. Jackson and the kids walk into the basin, unaware of being watched THROUGH BINOCULARS. Jackson spots an electronic measuring device and crouches to have a closer look. Elsewhere in the lake bed, we see sand seeping through CRACKS in the ground.

character.name: I swear you guys there was a lake here.

dialogue.text: The kids roll their eyes. EXT. EMPTY LAKE BED/YELLOWSTONE NATIONAL PARK - DAY A puddle of water is all that remains of the lake. Jackson and the kids walk into the basin, unaware of being watched THROUGH BINOCULARS. Jackson spots an electronic measuring device and crouches to have a closer look. Elsewhere in the lake bed, we see sand seeping through CRACKS in the ground.

segments.content: When he looks up, he sees heavily armed soldiers coming towards them from all sides.

dialogue.text: When he looks up, he sees heavily armed soldiers coming towards them from all sides.

segments.content: Through the BINOCULARS, we see Jackson and his kids arrested and led over a ridge. With this we reveal an ENORMOUS RESEARCH FACILITY with hundreds of tents and vehicles surrounding a massive drilling tower. EXT. RESEARCH FACILITY/YELLOWSTONE NATIONAL PARK - DAY Adrian Helmsley and Prof. West exit the drilling tower, both studying papers. Adrian notices Jackson and his kids nearby, being interrogated by an OFFICER.

dialogue.text: Through the BINOCULARS, we see Jackson and his kids arrested and led over a ridge. With this we reveal an ENORMOUS RESEARCH FACILITY with hundreds of tents and vehicles surrounding a massive drilling tower. EXT. RESEARCH FACILITY/YELLOWSTONE NATIONAL PARK - DAY Adrian Helmsley and Prof. West exit the drilling tower, both studying papers. Adrian notices Jackson and his kids nearby, being interrogated by an OFFICER.

segments.content: I'll be with you in a second,
Adrian walks towards them. Jackson stares at the officer with defiance.

dialogue.text: Adrian walks towards them. Jackson stares at the officer with defiance.

segments.content: ... And then you climbed over a posted
fence? Just like that?
I told you.
Isn't this supposed to be a National
Park? There shouldn't be fences. What
are you guys doing around here anyway?
Jackson turns and sees Adrian standing there.

dialogue.text: Jackson turns and sees Adrian standing there.

segments.content: The officer reluctantly hands him Jackson's license.

character.name: I'll handle this officer. Thank you.

dialogue.text: The officer reluctantly hands him Jackson's license.

segments.content: So, where did the lake go?
That's what we're trying to find out.
We think this whole area has become
potentially unstable. I would advise
you to take your kids and leave, Mr...
He throws a look at Jackson's drivers license.
... Curtis.
He looks up at Jackson with renewed interest.
Are you by any chance the Jackson
Curtis, the author of `Farewell
Atlantis'?
Jackson straightens up proudly. Lilly smiles.

dialogue.text: Jackson straightens up proudly. Lilly smiles.

segments.content: What a coincidence. I'm reading your
book, as we speak... first third,
around day 300, when the shuttle loses
communication with earth and drifts off
into space.
You're one of lucky 422 who bought it.
Actually I didn't buy it. My father
gave it to me.
Prof. West waves at Adrian from one of the container labs. Adrian hands back Jackson his drivers license.

dialogue.text: Prof. West waves at Adrian from one of the container labs. Adrian hands back Jackson his drivers license.

segments.content: Officer, can you return them to the
campgrounds, please.
(to Jackson)
Jackson and his kids look after Adrian hurrying away.

character.name: Pleasure to meet you, Mr. Curtis.

dialogue.text: Jackson and his kids look after Adrian hurrying away.

segments.content: He was very nice.

EXT. FOREST TRAIL/YELLOWSTONE NATIONAL PARK - LATER Jackson and the kids walk back to the campgrounds when suddenly CHARLIE FROST, 62, a crazy looking guy with binoculars around his neck, stands in their way.

dialogue.text: EXT. FOREST TRAIL/YELLOWSTONE NATIONAL PARK - LATER Jackson and the kids walk back to the campgrounds when suddenly CHARLIE FROST, 62, a crazy looking guy with binoculars around his neck, stands in their way.

segments.content: Jackson looks at him, instinctively picking up Lilly.

character.name: What did the government guys tell you?

dialogue.text: Jackson looks at him, instinctively picking up Lilly.

segments.content: They think it's not such a good idea to
climb over their fences. They feel the
area is unstable.
Charlie bursts out laughing.
Unstable! Ha-ha! They say its unstable!

With this he turns around and leaves. EXT. TENT/YELLOWSTONE NATIONAL PARK - DUSK Jackson is sitting on a camp chair, right outside the tent. He's on his laptop, looking enquiringly at an aerial picture of Yellowstone on Google earth. In the background we see the kids are in the tent.

dialogue.text: With this he turns around and leaves. EXT. TENT/YELLOWSTONE NATIONAL PARK - DUSK Jackson is sitting on a camp chair, right outside the tent. He's on his laptop, looking enquiringly at an aerial picture of Yellowstone on Google earth. In the background we see the kids are in the tent.

segments.content: There are mosquitos in here. Did
anybody spray the tent?
Jackson looks up, remembering he forgot the spray.
We'll get some of that tomorrow. For
tonight just put your head under the
blankie.
Daddy you said you weren't gonna work
on your book.
I'm not Honey, I promise. Are you
wearing your pull-ups?
Lilly nods as Jackson walks over and tucks her into bed. He
kisses her good night. He turns and is surprised to see Noah
typing a text on his cell phone.
Did mommy buy you that?
No... Gordon gave it to me for my
birthday.
Jackson takes the phone from out of Noah's hands.
Noah. Things like a cell phone have to
be discussed in the family.
Jackson reads the message Noah has typed `Hey Gordon, Camping Sucks!'. Hurt, Jackson hands back the phone.

dialogue.text: Jackson reads the message Noah has typed `Hey Gordon, Camping Sucks!'. Hurt, Jackson hands back the phone.

segments.content: EXT. RESEARCH FACILITY/YELLOWSTONE NATIONAL PARK - DUSK Commotion. The base packs up. Adrian and Prof. West duck low as they board a chopper. Adrian is on the phone.

dialogue.text: EXT. RESEARCH FACILITY/YELLOWSTONE NATIONAL PARK - DUSK Commotion. The base packs up. Adrian and Prof. West duck low as they board a chopper. Adrian is on the phone.

segments.content: ... You have to immediately inform the
President, Mr Anheuser. The readings
look much worse than I expected.
Plus Satnam's neutrino figures from
We hear Anheuser, yelling.

dialogue.text: We hear Anheuser, yelling.

segments.content: ... But you guys said...

A second later the chopper lifts off. INT. LIMO/YELLOWSTONE NATIONAL PARK - DUSK Jackson has his laptop open with the cursor blinking away on the words `Chapter Seven'. But he can't concentrate on writing after what Noah has said. A chopper flies overhead. Jackson follows it's path over the campsite and his eyes fall on an American flag fluttering on top of a massive radio antennae. This belongs to an RV truck. Through the RV's window, Jackson sees the silhouette of Charlie Frost, the guy with the binoculars, speaking into a microphone. Curious, Jackson flicks on the radio and twists the dial.

character.name: We were wrong! By five or six months...

dialogue.text: A second later the chopper lifts off. INT. LIMO/YELLOWSTONE NATIONAL PARK - DUSK Jackson has his laptop open with the cursor blinking away on the words `Chapter Seven'. But he can't concentrate on writing after what Noah has said. A chopper flies overhead. Jackson follows it's path over the campsite and his eyes fall on an American flag fluttering on top of a massive radio antennae. This belongs to an RV truck. ... We have a listener calling in. Bill
from Cooke City, you're on the Charlie

(Bill's voice)
I wanted to know, where will this all

(Charlie's voice)
Well, something like this could only

cracking under their asses already,

Our family believes in the gospel of
our Lord Jesus.

(Charlie's voice)

segments.content: ... This is Charlie Frost reporting
live from Yellowstone National Park,
soon to become the world's largest
active volcano.
Charlie is about to take a bite of his sandwich, when there's
a knock on the door. Jackson sticks his head in.
Hi. Mind if I join you?
Charlie bites into his sandwich as Jackson looks around at all the equipment.

character.name: I only got a few minutes.

dialogue.text: Charlie bites into his sandwich as Jackson looks around at all the equipment.

segments.content: I just heard part of your broadcast...
Mind me asking a question? What exactly
is it... that will start in Hollywood?
Actually it's gonna be the whole west
coast...
What are you talking about?
The apocalypse, the end of days. The
Mayans knew it, the I Ching and the
Charlie looks at his watch.

dialogue.text: Charlie looks at his watch.

segments.content: I got to eat... Just check my blog. You
can download it for free.
Charlie clicks on his laptop.
... However, we do take donations.
A crudely animated film starts to play. Charlie narrates on
screen in an overly dramatic fashion.
In the year 2012 a cataclysmic event
will unfold. Caused by an alignment of
the planets in our solar system that
only happens every 640,000 years...
Charlie appears as an animated figure holding an orange.

character.name: Just imagine the earth as an Orange...

dialogue.text: Charlie appears as an animated figure holding an orange.

segments.content: ... our sun will begin to emit such
extreme amounts of radiation, that the
core of the earth will melt - that's
the inside part of the Orange, leaving
the crust of our planet free to shift.
On screen the middle of the orange shrinks, now the skin
moves freely around it.
In 1958, Prof. Hapgood named it `Earth
A faded portrait of a scientist appears on screen.

dialogue.text: A faded portrait of a scientist appears on screen.

segments.content: ... and Albert Einstein endorsed it...
The infamous photo of Einstein, sticking out his tongue.
The forces of mother nature will be so
devastating it will bring an end to
this world on winter solstice 12-21-12.
The film ends with an image of the whole earth covered with
water.
Charlie shuts the laptop.
Pretty neat, huh? It's a big hit on
YouTube. I did the animation myself.
I know what you're thinking. But all
the governments know about this.
If they all knew, don't you think
somebody would tell us?
They can't. Just think about it. First
the stockmarket would crash...
Charlie opens a can of beer. Phsssh!
Then the economy... boom. The dollar...
boom. And then the people in the
streets...
(mimicking gun fire)
Boom, boom! Pandemonium, revolution,
war! They would never tell us. Beer?
Jackson shakes his head still struggling to digest this.
Only if you're some Sheik, Bill Gates,
or maybe one of those Russian
billionaires do you stand a chance to
buy a seat.
A seat?
They're building spaceships, man.
Oh... I see.
No really... One of my listeners, a
geography professor at UTSC, has even
figured out where they're building
them. He sent me a map.
Well... Charlie, I think I gotta go. My
kids are sleeping.
Charlie looks at him bug eyed.
Get them out of Yellowstone, man. It's
gonna get ugly here.
As Jackson exits, Charlie gets back on the air.

dialogue.text: As Jackson exits, Charlie gets back on the air.

segments.content: Sorry for the delay, folks. But even in
times like these, a man has got to
eat...

segments.content:
Westwood. The parking lot of Gelson's is nearly empty.

          Eerie silence. Suddenly some of the cars begin to shift in

          place from an unseen force. A small CRACK creases the asphalt

          and slowly crawls towards the brightly lit supermarket.

Muzak is playing. Kate and her boyfriend Gordon are shopping

          late. She picks up some pull-ups for Lilly, Gordon steps up

          behind her, wrapping his arms around her waist.
He reaches up and touches her breasts.

character.name: Why don't we make a baby?

dialogue.text: He reaches up and touches her breasts.

segments.content: Gordon lets go of her with mock disappointment.

dialogue.text: Gordon lets go of her with mock disappointment.

segments.content: Honey, I created them. And now suddenly

Kate pushes him away and moves on. A few customers are paying at the checkout stand. BEHIND THEM: Huge glass windows reveal cars slowly sliding into the ever widening crack in the parking lot. Nobody inside notices. Gordon catches up with Kate.

dialogue.text: Kate pushes him away and moves on. A few customers are paying at the checkout stand. BEHIND THEM: Huge glass windows reveal cars slowly sliding into the ever widening crack in the parking lot. Nobody inside notices. Gordon catches up with Kate.

segments.content: You always act strange after he shows
up?
Just because I don't care for your
arrogant humor doesn't mean I'm acting
strange. He is the father of my kids.
Maybe biologically. Can I remind you
what that guy did? First you gave up
med school to have Noah... Then you
practically raise him and Lilly by
yourself while he sat glued to a laptop
writing that junk.
Some of his stuff is actually... He's
published Gordon.
Yeah, published! You know your mother
was right. You've always been drawn to
guys with lofty dreams and empty
pockets. But not this time right,
sweetheart?
Kate smiles awkwardly and picks up a can of soup. The shelf
in front of her shakes for a moment.
Did you see that?
Kate slowly puts the cans of soup into her cart and looks around. Gordon senses a problem between them.

dialogue.text: Kate slowly puts the cans of soup into her cart and looks around. Gordon senses a problem between them.

segments.content: You know Kate, we have to keep working
at this... our relationship. Because I

I mean Honey, I feel like... something

Before Gordon finishes his sentence--
A violent ROAR! From front to back, the entire supermarket
rips open right between Kate and Gordon.
The few customers scream in horror at the sight of the huge
crevasse forming beneath them. Kate and Gordon are thrown up
against opposite aisles holding on for dear life.
They cling to the columns as the shelves fold into the ever
widening crack...
Jackson puts down some groceries at the checkout.
Just stop scratching. You'll get them

Something for Mosquito bites please?
Before or after?
The woman looks at Lilly and Noah with their red lumps.

segments.content: Look! Mrs. Birnbaum, my teacher is on

The gap in the ground is enormous now, at least half a mile long and 200 feet wide.

dialogue.text: The gap in the ground is enormous now, at least half a mile long and 200 feet wide.

segments.content: Kids, we have to pack up and go find

President Wilson and Anheuser walk towards the Situation

Sir, you have to initiate the boarding
process immediately.
Is this even possible? What's our

They estimate four of the ships will be
ready for launch.
The President is shocked by this news.
Only four?
If it's alright with you sir, I'll
brief the panel about the new
development.
I'd rather have Adrian do that. They
trust him. I told him to be in on the
meeting.
Anheuser fumes as they enter the situation room.

Flat screens line the walls. A video conference is under way

          with each of the G8 members represented.
Ladies and Gentlemen, we all knew this
day would come. But we never imagined
it would come this soon.
He looks over to Adrian.
I would like to pass this over to my
science advisor, Adrian Helmsley.
Adrian steps up and gathers himself. Anheuser watches.
Pointing to a set of charts.

dialogue.text: Pointing to a set of charts.

segments.content: ... According to our latest data from
Yellowstone, the temperature of the
subterranean crust of the earth, the

much faster than anticipated...
All the heads of state are glued to his words.
... This causes extreme polar
instability. The magnetic fields have

The German Chancellor, a woman, interrupts.
Adrian glances to Professor West, standing in the back.

Apologies Prime minster. He's still new

President Wilson steps up.
Nevertheless, Mr. Antonioni, we have to

We hear CHEERING and APPLAUSE.
Introducing the 320 pound muscle

... There will be famines, pestilences

Jackson has to maneuver through the people. Banners read:
`Prepare for the End'-- 'You cannot escape his judgement'--
Alec looks up from his video game, annoyed.

Are you guys blind? I can't run people

Jackson stops in front of the Gulfstream. SASHA, 40, Yuri's

going on a big ship.

We hold on his face as it hits him like a ton of bricks: THE CRAZY RADIO HOST, CHARLIE FROST WAS RIGHT! Frantically Jackson looks around and spots a MAN in overalls working on a twin engine Cessna. On the TV, the interview comes to an end.
... it looks to me, like the worst is

That moment a MASSIVE QUAKE hits Los Angeles.
Everybody dives under the table.

Gordon pulls Kate and the kids close as the earth shakes

Jackson flies into the driveway and runs into the house.

We have to leave! Noah, let's go!
I think we're safer here!
The whole house rides up and down like on a wave.

But I'm supposed to check all these

Noah discovers the giant crevasse forming behind them.

Gordon fights to maintain control but they begin to be pulled down. The daylight vanishes. Debris and mud smashes into the plane from all sides. The canyon walls erupt.

flying directly into the collapsing towers of downtown Los
Angeles!
Like a roller coaster, Gordon manages to weave the little
plane through the tumbling high rises.
They dive one last time to evade the plummeting US BANK
TOWER, the tallest building on the west coast.
All are dead silent as they watch the whole of Los Angeles
crumble beneath them. Kate covers Lilly's eyes.
(in total shock)
Jackson looks at Kate and notices her cut.

Do we have enough fuel to make it to

The gigantic cruise ship plows through the Pacific. We hear

heading.raw_text: INT. BAR/FREEDOM OF THE SEAS - DAY

segments.content:
Adrian's father Harry and his partner Tony are on stage.

          Harry on the piano, singing, Tony playing the bass. A waiter

          brings drinks. Water for Harry, and a brightly colored

          cocktail for Tony.
You got fans Tony...
Tony raises his glass to two old ladies who are sitting at
the bar.
There's a call for you Harry. Want me
to take a message?
(while still playing)
The waiter nods. A few more bars of music, then applause.

dialogue.text: The waiter nods. A few more bars of music, then applause.

segments.content: (into the microphone)
Thank you ladies and gentlemen. Let's
hear it for the one and only Tony
Delgado... And I'm Harry Helmsley and
we'll be back after a short pit stop.
Applause. Harry rushes off stage.
Dad... what I have to tell you is very
serious...

Adrian is standing in a dark corner. Behind him people are

          packing up, carrying boxes.
You remember when I told you about the
dam in China? Well, it's happening much
sooner than we anticipated.
Harry's face has turned serious.
The President has ordered us to clear
out the White House.
Hah... About time someone cleaned up
that mess.
Adrian fights back the tears.
Where are you, dad? What exactly is the
course of the `Freedom' right now?...
It's all good, Adrian. Don't worry
about your old man. You have more
important things to do now.
There's a tremor in Harry's voice.
You know, your mom and I, we had a hell
of a great life... and a hell of a
great kid too.
And the `Freedom' is a pretty big ship
you know... Don't write your old man
off, just yet.
A tear runs down Adrian's face.
... Besides, I could never leave Tony
alone. You know how he can't keep
decent time by himself.
Pause.
INT. GALLEY/CRUISE SHIP - DAY Harry bites his lip.

dialogue.text: INT. GALLEY/CRUISE SHIP - DAY Harry bites his lip.

After twenty-five years on the wagon?
Why not? Who cares how long we do
certain things? How long we drink
booze, how long we talk to people... Or
how long we don't talk to people.
Harry grabs Tony by his shirt.
Woah!... Harry, what's the matter with

Call your kid, you stubborn old ass.
I'm not going back on that stage unless
you promise to call him.
Tony, the ladies are waiting for you.
Harry stares him down.

dialogue.text: Harry stares him down.

segments.content: Harry smiles, downs his bourbon and walks back on stage.

character.name: Yeah, maybe I should call him...

dialogue.text: Harry smiles, downs his bourbon and walks back on stage.

segments.content: Adrian enters his office. The TV is on.
... There is little we know at this
point, but the earthquake registered at
10.1 on the Richter scale. The whole of
the Western seaboard was hit...
Assistants stare at the news in shocked disbelief, some of
them are crying. Prof. West appears at the door.
(pointing at the TV)
Have you seen this?
Prof. West silently nods and beckons Adrian, who follows him
down the hall into a dark control room. They look at a wall-
sized high def monitor.
We have satellite images. Here's the
sequence we've got so far.
On the monitors, detailed satellite imagery displays how the
monstrous quake unfolds, leaving California sliding into the
sea.
Any news from Yellowstone?
Anytime now.

heading.subject: TONE NATIONAL PARK
heading.raw_text: EXT. RESEARCH FACILITY/YELLOWSTONE NATIONAL PARK - DAY

segments.content:
The base is abandoned but for a few structures and the

          enormous drilling tower.

          Gordon manages to land the plane next to what looks like a

          fueling station. Jackson leaps out checking the pump.
Guys, there's fuel! Fill her up and
I'll look for Charlie.
You're sure about this?
Kate, everything this guy said so far
has happened. I'll be right back.
Jackson runs off towards the hills.
Lilly runs after him. Jackson picks her up.

character.name: Daddy wait! I wanna come with you!

dialogue.text: Lilly runs after him. Jackson picks her up.

segments.content: Lilly! Come back!
Kate watches as they disappear, worried. Noah and Gordon have started to fuel the plane.

dialogue.text: Kate watches as they disappear, worried. Noah and Gordon have started to fuel the plane.

heading.subject: TONE NATIONAL PARK
heading.raw_text: EXT. CHARLIE'S RV/YELLOWSTONE NATIONAL PARK - DAY

segments.content:
Jackson and Lilly find Charlie's RV with it's door hanging

          open. They enter. The key is in the ignition. The radio

          transmitters are on, but Charlie is gone. Jackson fiddles

          with the switches and Charlie's voice comes on.
... I am standing here at the highest
point on what is the rim of this super
volcano...
Jackson jumps behind the wheel and turns the ignition.

character.name: He's got to be close by, Lil'bee...

dialogue.text: Jackson jumps behind the wheel and turns the ignition.

segments.content: Let's go back, Daddy.
Listen to me. We have to find Charlie.
He's got a secret map, you know, like
That catches her interest.

dialogue.text: That catches her interest.

segments.content: Lil', we have to work as a team now,
okay? You have to help me.
Jackson passes her his mobile phone. Lilly nods. He throws
the RV into gear and they speed off over the bumpy terrain.
In their dust, we see the earth fissuring!
Jackson drives like a bat out of hell.
... The last time this baby blew, was
640,000 years ago...
Jackson tears up the mountain looking for Charlie. EXT. EMPTY ARMY BASE/YELLOWSTONE NATIONAL PARK - DAY Kate's phone rings.

dialogue.text: Jackson tears up the mountain looking for Charlie. EXT. EMPTY ARMY BASE/YELLOWSTONE NATIONAL PARK - DAY Kate's phone rings.

segments.content: Hi mommy...
INT. RV/YELLOWSTONE NATIONAL PARK - DAY Jackson hears the stress in Kate's voice. He hisses at Lilly.

dialogue.text: INT. RV/YELLOWSTONE NATIONAL PARK - DAY Jackson hears the stress in Kate's voice. He hisses at Lilly.

segments.content: Tell her we'll be back in ten minutes.
Jackson grimaces. EXT. RESEARCH FACILITY/YELLOWSTONE NATIONAL PARK - DAY Kate tries to keep it together for Lilly.

character.name: We're looking for a secret map, mommy.

dialogue.text: Jackson grimaces. EXT. RESEARCH FACILITY/YELLOWSTONE NATIONAL PARK - DAY Kate tries to keep it together for Lilly.

segments.content: Let me speak to your daddy, darling.
Daddy can't talk right now, he's
driving really fast...
The RV runs over a boulder. Lilly hits the roof.
Ouch!
In the background Kate hears the voice of Charlie Frost.
... I tell you guys, any minute now...
any minute the fireworks will start...
Who's in the car with you? Who's that
man screaming?
He's not in the car. He's on a mountain
waiting for fireworks.
Lilly spots Charlie way up on a ridge. He has erected his ten
foot radio antenna with the flag fluttering on top.
(to Jackson)
There he is! Up there!
You're the best, darling. Give Daddy
the phone...
(into the phone)
The road ends just below the mountain peak.

character.name: Kate I am sorry, I can't talk...

dialogue.text: The road ends just below the mountain peak.

segments.content: Jackson sees Charlie up above, broadcasting. He hangs up the phone and jumps out of the RV.

character.name: Bring back my child, Jackson! NOW!

dialogue.text: Jackson sees Charlie up above, broadcasting. He hangs up the phone and jumps out of the RV.

segments.content: You wait here for me! You watch the
ship while Captain Curtis talks to the
pirate. Okay?
Jackson climbs up to Charlie. EXT. MOUNTAIN PEAK/YELLOWSTONE NATIONAL PARK - DAY Charlie has his broadcasting equipment strapped to his body. The antenna's flag is whipping in the wind.

dialogue.text: Jackson climbs up to Charlie. EXT. MOUNTAIN PEAK/YELLOWSTONE NATIONAL PARK - DAY Charlie has his broadcasting equipment strapped to his body. The antenna's flag is whipping in the wind.

segments.content: (into his mic)
... I wish you guys at home could see
this on TV...
He notices Jackson and muffles the microphone.
How did you make it up here? Thought
you were toast.
The spaceships Charlie, where are they?
You can't make it there.
We have a plane. We can get you out of
here too. Let's go Charlie!
All around the landscape begins to collapse. A three mile
crater forms, revealing the awe-inspiring sight of the super-
volcano.
You'll never make it out in time. Just
stay and enjoy the big bang. That your
kid?
Jackson discovers Lilly standing behind him, staring at
Charlie with her big brown eyes.
Jackson grabs Charlie lifting him off the ground.
Where is that god damn map!
Easy, easy. Watch the mic... I don't
know. Somewhere in my camper.
A low rumble builds to a rapturous thunder as MILLIONS OF
BIRDS tear into flight.
Wow! Look at that!...
(into his mic)
Fly birdies fly! This marks the last
day of the United States of America
folks and by tomorrow...
The mouth of the volcano starts to break apart revealing
molten lava underneath.
... the last of mankind. Soon they'll
see us from a million miles away, out
there in the milky way...
Jackson grabs his wide eyed daughter and races down the
mountain.

heading.subject: TONE NATIONAL PARK
heading.raw_text: EXT. BELOW MOUNTAIN PEAK/YELLOWSTONE NATIONAL PARK - DAY

segments.content:
Jackson and Lilly jump into the RV and races off, with

          Charlie's broadcast still playing.
... The ash cloud will travel
everywhere.
First the lights will go out in Vegas,
then Dallas, St. Louis and then
Jackson's cell phone rings and he picks up.

dialogue.text: Jackson's cell phone rings and he picks up.

segments.content: EXT. RESEARCH FACILITY/YELLOWSTONE NATIONAL PARK - DAY

dialogue.text: EXT. RESEARCH FACILITY/YELLOWSTONE NATIONAL PARK - DAY

segments.content: Jackson, things are really looking bad
here!
In that instant, the air around them vanishes, as if sucked
from the landscape into a vacuum.
THE BIGGEST EXPLOSION THE WORLD HAS EVER SEEN... At least in
the last 640,000 years.
To them, all this occurs in total silence. The sound of the
eruption has not reached them yet.
They are frozen, unable to comprehend what is happening.

heading.subject: TONE NATIONAL PARK
heading.raw_text: EXT. MOUNTAIN PEAK/YELLOWSTONE NATIONAL PARK - DAY

segments.content: The explosion begins to resembles an atomic mushroom.
... it's beautiful, kids! Just
beautiful!
The sound waves reach Charlie, throwing him to the ground.

heading.subject: TONE NATIONAL PARK
heading.raw_text: EXT. DIRT ROAD/YELLOWSTONE NATIONAL PARK - DAY

segments.content:
The RV flies over the rugged terrain. Everywhere the earth is

          cracking, falling apart. Jackson struggles to swerve around

          the disappearing landscape.
Lilly has discovered the expanding ASH CLOUD behind them.

dialogue.text: Lilly has discovered the expanding ASH CLOUD behind them.

segments.content: The THUNDERING sound envelopes them! On the radio, the voice of Charlie is getting shrill.

dialogue.text: The THUNDERING sound envelopes them! On the radio, the voice of Charlie is getting shrill.

segments.content: EXT. MOUNTAIN PEAK/YELLOWSTONE NATIONAL PARK - DAY Charlie slowly tries to stand again, silhouetted against the cloud of dust and fire towering above him. Flaming rocks fly towards him. When they hit the ground, they detonate like fire bombs.

dialogue.text: EXT. MOUNTAIN PEAK/YELLOWSTONE NATIONAL PARK - DAY Charlie slowly tries to stand again, silhouetted against the cloud of dust and fire towering above him. Flaming rocks fly towards him. When they hit the ground, they detonate like fire bombs.

segments.content: EXT. DIRT ROAD/YELLOWSTONE NATIONAL PARK - DAY Rocks plummet like comets around the RV as Jackson races over a collapsing bridge. On the radio, in his delirious state, Charlie begins to sing...

dialogue.text: EXT. DIRT ROAD/YELLOWSTONE NATIONAL PARK - DAY Rocks plummet like comets around the RV as Jackson races over a collapsing bridge. On the radio, in his delirious state, Charlie begins to sing...

segments.content: `This is the end, my friend'...
Yellowstone looks like a war zone. The RV dodges the
bombardment of fire and rock.

heading.subject: TONE NATIONAL PARK
heading.raw_text: EXT. MOUNTAIN PEAK/YELLOWSTONE NATIONAL PARK - DAY

segments.content:
Huge tree trunks and glowing boulders fly at Charlie through

          the ashes. He screams at the top of his lungs.
... Folks, always remember, you heard
it first from Charlie.
A second later, Charlie's radio antenna comes spinning like a
scythe through the air. It decapitates Charlie in an instant.

heading.subject: TONE NATIONAL PARK
heading.raw_text: EXT. DIRT ROAD/YELLOWSTONE NATIONAL PARK - DAY

segments.content:
The radio cuts out. The forest and the camp grounds are mown

          flat by the extreme force of the ASH CLOUD. In the rear view

          mirror Jackson sees it gaining on them.

A firebomb hits the RV, ripping half the roof off.

          Lilly barely makes it under the dashboard.
Stay down there, Lil'! We're almost
there! Just keep looking at daddy.
Jackson spots the little Cessna in the distance.

heading.subject: TONE NATIONAL PARK
heading.raw_text: EXT. EMPTY ARMY BASE/YELLOWSTONE NATIONAL PARK - DAY

segments.content:
At the entrance to the airstrip a huge crevasse forms,

          cutting the RV off from reaching the plane.

          Lilly sticks out her head.
Jackson swerves wildly to miss the crack, sending Lilly flying out. Without thinking, he lets go of the wheel, lunging after her and pulling her back inside.

dialogue.text: Jackson swerves wildly to miss the crack, sending Lilly flying out. Without thinking, he lets go of the wheel, lunging after her and pulling her back inside.

segments.content: Jackson races the RV alongside the forming crack. Spotting a narrow point in the crevasse, he makes a decision. Slamming the accelerator down, he races towards it at full speed. Moments later the RV is airborne! Kate watches, too shocked to scream. A few drawn out seconds. Then the RV touches down, crashing 200 feet from the plane. Kate runs towards the wreckage of the camper. Lilly jumps out, racing into her mom's arms. Jackson turns and sees the cloud approaching.

dialogue.text: Jackson races the RV alongside the forming crack. Spotting a narrow point in the crevasse, he makes a decision. Slamming the accelerator down, he races towards it at full speed. Moments later the RV is airborne! Kate watches, too shocked to scream. A few drawn out seconds. Then the RV touches down, crashing 200 feet from the plane. Kate runs towards the wreckage of the camper. Lilly jumps out, racing into her mom's arms. Jackson turns and sees the cloud approaching.

segments.content: Kate pulls Lilly back to the plane. Jackson jumps into the back of the RV scavenging through the shelves, looking for Charlie's map. Kate lifts Lilly onto the wing of the plane. Gordon revs up the engines.

character.name: You guys go! I'll be right there!

dialogue.text: Kate pulls Lilly back to the plane. Jackson jumps into the back of the RV scavenging through the shelves, looking for Charlie's map. Kate lifts Lilly onto the wing of the plane. Gordon revs up the engines.

segments.content: Noah pulls his little sister into the cockpit.

dialogue.text: Noah pulls his little sister into the cockpit.

segments.content: Fiery rocks rain from the sky, detonating to the right and
left of their plane as Kate climbs in.
We have to take off!
No!
Where's daddy?!
Kate, I'm sorry but if we wait we'll
all die!
Gordon pushes the throttle. The plane starts to move. Kate
screams.

Back in the RV, Jackson is frantically going through the masses of books and papers on the shelves. Finally, a map. He unfolds it. But it's only of the London underground system. He throws it to the ground and finds another. This time he's lucky! There are markings everywhere. As he races to the door, the ground gives way beneath the RV. Kate and the kids watch it disappear from sight.

dialogue.text: Back in the RV, Jackson is frantically going through the masses of books and papers on the shelves. Finally, a map. He unfolds it. But it's only of the London underground system. He throws it to the ground and finds another. This time he's lucky! There are markings everywhere. As he races to the door, the ground gives way beneath the RV. Kate and the kids watch it disappear from sight.

segments.content:
Noah begins to cry and Lilly clings to her mom. Gordon just

          stares, paralyzed.

          The ASH CLOUD is almost upon them!

          Gordon takes action and accelerates the plane.

          Kate turns back. A hand emerges from the crevasse. Then

          another, holding a map. Her face lights up.
Jackson pulls himself up and sprints towards them, the map in his hand.

dialogue.text: Jackson pulls himself up and sprints towards them, the map in his hand.

segments.content: Kate leans out of the cockpit reaching for him.

dialogue.text: Kate leans out of the cockpit reaching for him.

segments.content: Faster Dad. You can make it!
Kate, grab him for god sake. We're
almost out of runway.
Using every last ounce of energy, Jackson leaps onto the wing
and is yanked into the plane by Kate.
Just at that moment, the plane lifts off.
Jackson falls into the cockpit, completely out of breath.
Lilly crawls over and hugs him.

Now all eyes are glued to the speedometer. 180... 190... The violent ASH CLOUD is hitting their tail rudder. The plane swerves wildly! Gordon gets it back under control. The speedometer finally creeps towards 200 mph and the CLOUD slowly falls back. Everybody breathes a sigh of relief.

dialogue.text: Now all eyes are glued to the speedometer. 180... 190... The violent ASH CLOUD is hitting their tail rudder. The plane swerves wildly! Gordon gets it back under control. The speedometer finally creeps towards 200 mph and the CLOUD slowly falls back. Everybody breathes a sigh of relief.

segments.content: So, now that you got your map, where
are we going?
Jackson unfolds it and takes a look. Hundreds of markings
clutter the map. In the left corner he discovers a large
letter C followed by H - I - N - A.
He looks up.
We're gonna need a bigger plane.

heading.subject: WING/WHITE HOUSE
heading.raw_text: INT. WEST WING/WHITE HOUSE - LATE AFTERNOON

segments.content:
The White House is being evacuated. Amidst the chaos stands

          Anheuser. Adrian puts down a phone and looks at him.
Just a few minutes ago Yellowstone
erupted, sir. The ash cloud will reach
Washington in roughly 7 hours. Maybe 6.
We have strong easterly winds...
And the crustal displacement?
Anheuser starts walking, Adrian trails behind.

dialogue.text: Anheuser starts walking, Adrian trails behind.

segments.content: Let's get the government airborne
and... I mean now.

heading.raw_text: INT. OVAL OFFICE/WHITE HOUSE - LATE AFTERNOON

segments.content:
Anheuser and Adrian burst into the Anteroom of the Oval

          Office. The President's secretary, SALLY, 55, is packing.
Sally looks up stone faced.

dialogue.text: Sally looks up stone faced.

segments.content: He said he wanted to spend a few
minutes alone. I think he's over at the
chapel.
The whole North American continent is
about to perish, and Wilson decides to
go to church!
Adrian shoots an angry look at Anheuser.
He's praying sir. Which considering the
circumstances is not a bad idea.
Maybe. But right now I need the leader
of the free world off his knees and on
Air Force One. Wheels up 1900 hours.
Anheuser walks away. Adrian and Sally exchange a look.

character.name: Can I leave that with you Helmsley?

dialogue.text: Anheuser walks away. Adrian and Sally exchange a look.

segments.content: INT. CHAPEL/WHITE HOUSE - SUNSET Adrian finds the President standing near the front of the chapel.

character.name: I really don't like that man.

dialogue.text: INT. CHAPEL/WHITE HOUSE - SUNSET Adrian finds the President standing near the front of the chapel.

segments.content: Mr. President? We need to get you out
of Washington immediately.
President Wilson stays with his head bowed.
Now matter how idealistic you are
taking office. You lose your innocence
behind that desk.
Laura was right. People have died
because of the decisions I made.
He turns to face Adrian.

dialogue.text: He turns to face Adrian.

segments.content: This quietly affects Adrian.

dialogue.text: This quietly affects Adrian.

segments.content: Laura's never looked at me like that
before. Only once... When I told her,
her mother had died. You knew the first
lady?
A little.
You know what she said to me that night
we brought her to the hospital?
`Tommy... I think you should do a
lottery. Every one should have a chance
to go'. That's what Dorothy said to me.
That's what we should have done.
President Wilson looks Adrian in the eyes.

character.name: There would have been chaos, sir.

dialogue.text: President Wilson looks Adrian in the eyes.

segments.content: You know what I believe, Adrian. I
believe nature should choose for
itself, from itself.
Adrian takes this in.
Don't let her go. You'll regret it if
you do. Prove to Laura what kind of a
man you are. And I'll do the same...
You go now. And watch your back for
Anheuser.
Adrian stares at the President in disbelief.
But sir?
A tense moment before Adrian starts to walk away. Just as he exits the chapel, Wilson calls after him.

dialogue.text: A tense moment before Adrian starts to walk away. Just as he exits the chapel, Wilson calls after him.

segments.content: Would you tell my daughter... there's
nothing on earth that I cherish more
than her.
We hold on President Wilson's face.

Most of Las Vegas is destroyed. A 200 foot wide canyon now

          divides sin city along its famous strip. The towering casinos

          still teeter along the canyon's rim.

          All forms of emergency rescue operations are deployed around

          the city.

          In the FOREGROUND, we see Las Vegas International Airport,

          its runway cut dramatically short. Large pieces of tarmac

          continue to break off into the crevasse.

Gordon maneuvers his plane through the chaos. Airplanes are

          strewn about the runway. Passengers everywhere.
I told you we should have gone to my
parents' in the Rockies.
Jackson looks around frantically.

character.name: Gordon's right. Look at this mess.

dialogue.text: Jackson looks around frantically.

segments.content: You don't understand, it's our only
chance.
This isn't one of your crazy stories
now. How the hell are we gonna make it
to China?
Gordon, without Jackson, we'd never
have made it out of California.
Silence. Noah is right and they know it. They taxi past a
private jet whose front wheel is stuck in a hole in the
tarmac.
We hear a dog barking and the CAMERA finds Tamara, with
Caesar in her arms.
Careful with the landing gear!
(in Russian)
An airport tow truck attempts to pull Yuri's Gulfstream jet out. Sasha, the pilot, helps. A safety announcement echoes through the whole area.

character.name: Tamara, get the boys out of the way!

dialogue.text: An airport tow truck attempts to pull Yuri's Gulfstream jet out. Sasha, the pilot, helps. A safety announcement echoes through the whole area.

segments.content: (over loudspeaker)
Attention! The US National Guard has
informed us, that an extremely
hazardous ash cloud is headed towards
the city of Las Vegas.
Tamara looks scared and secretly reaches for Sasha's hand.
They share an intimate look, no one else sees.
We strongly advise every one to move
indoors immediately...
The tow truck driver panics and runs inside.
We move in on Yuri. For the first time he looks helpless.
In the background, Jackson and his family join the panicked
crowd heading towards the terminal building. Firemen and
rescue workers usher them forward.
Jackson and his family are swept along.

character.name: Let's move people! Inside the terminal!

dialogue.text: Jackson and his family are swept along.

heading.raw_text: INT. AIR FORCE ONE/ARLINGTON AIRPORT - DUSK

segments.content:
Adrian rushes up the stairs of Air Force One, approaching one

          of the flight officers.
Where's Anheuser?
Adrian moves on. INT. COMMAND CENTER/AIR FORCE ONE - DUSK Adrian enters. Anheuser immediately senses something is amiss.

dialogue.text: Adrian moves on. INT. COMMAND CENTER/AIR FORCE ONE - DUSK Adrian enters. Anheuser immediately senses something is amiss.

segments.content: The President is not coming. I couldn't
convince him to.
Everyone in the room looks up, speechless.
So, the captain doesn't want to leave
his sinking ship?
Well, Mr. Helmsley, we just learned
that the Vice President's chopper
crashed 80 miles north of Atlanta.
Adrian is shocked.
What about the Speaker of the House?
In this chaos... I have no idea!
But she's Commander In Chief now. Sir,
Anheuser moves in dangerously close.

dialogue.text: Anheuser moves in dangerously close.

segments.content: Laura quietly enters the Command Center, as Anheuser and Adrian stare each other down.

character.name: I don't care what you think, Helmsley.

dialogue.text: Laura quietly enters the Command Center, as Anheuser and Adrian stare each other down.

segments.content: Your ass only made it into the White
House, because your old man knew the
First Lady... and because of all that
affirmative action bullshit.
Anheuser takes it even further.
There was a white kid, much more
qualified than you. Just so you know.
Adrian's face is ashen.
Everyone turns to Laura. Silence.

dialogue.text: Everyone turns to Laura. Silence.

segments.content: Suddenly, the engines of Air Force One turn over. Laura panics.

character.name: He wanted to stay with his people.

dialogue.text: Suddenly, the engines of Air Force One turn over. Laura panics.

segments.content: Adrian tries to hold her close to him. Anheuser sees this intimate moment and gives a suspicious, questioning look. A second later Laura pushes Adrian away.

dialogue.text: Adrian tries to hold her close to him. Anheuser sees this intimate moment and gives a suspicious, questioning look. A second later Laura pushes Adrian away.

segments.content: Let me get out. Mr. Anheuser - tell the
Captain.
There is a protocol for just this
situation Ms. Wilson and I'm afraid
we'll have to follow it to the letter.
Anheuser turns to an officer.
Tell the Captain, to take off
immediately.
Laura looks at him incredulously.

heading.raw_text: INT. AIRPORT TERMINAL/LAS VEGAS AIRPORT - DUSK

segments.content: Emergency lights illuminate the densely populated terminal.
One of the rescue workers yells, pushing Jackson and his family back. Frustrated, Jackson turns to Kate and Gordon.

character.name: People, stay away from the windows!

dialogue.text: One of the rescue workers yells, pushing Jackson and his family back. Frustrated, Jackson turns to Kate and Gordon.

segments.content: Suddenly a voice...

dialogue.text: Suddenly a voice...

segments.content: They all turn and stare at Tamara, holding her little dog against her plump breasts. Kate gives Gordon a look.

character.name: Dr. Silberman? What are you doing here?

dialogue.text: They all turn and stare at Tamara, holding her little dog against her plump breasts. Kate gives Gordon a look.

segments.content: She's a patient, honey.
But when Jackson discovers Yuri behind her, his tone suddenly changes. He gets in Yuri's face.

dialogue.text: But when Jackson discovers Yuri behind her, his tone suddenly changes. He gets in Yuri's face.

segments.content: You bastard. You knew it all along!
(at the twins)
You and those spoiled rotten sons of
yours...
Sasha comes running in and cuts through this.
I found us a plane, an Antonov. They
were just about to take off, but the
tower didn't let them.
Can you still fly that thing?
Lilly chimes in.

character.name: Sure... But I need a copilot.

dialogue.text: Lilly chimes in.

segments.content: Gordon is a pilot.
Before Gordon can protest Jackson picks up Lilly.
They burst through the emergency exit, setting off an alarm. Emergency personnel yell after them.

dialogue.text: They burst through the emergency exit, setting off an alarm. Emergency personnel yell after them.

segments.content: Hey! Stop! You can't go out there! Come
back!
But they keep on running. Sasha now leads the way.

heading.raw_text: EXT. AIR FIELD/LAS VEGAS AIRPORT - DUSK

segments.content:
They race around the corner and come to a halt. Before them,

          a Russian freight plane of enormous size--

          The ANTONOV 225, the biggest aircraft in the world.
Wow, that is a big plane.
Sasha, who has run ahead turns back and sees: A MASSIVE GREY WALL OF ASH moving towards the airport.

dialogue.text: Sasha, who has run ahead turns back and sees: A MASSIVE GREY WALL OF ASH moving towards the airport.

segments.content: They all run after him up the stairs. INT. COCKPIT/ANTONOV - DUSK Sasha enters the cockpit and puts on the headset while readying the plane for takeoff.

dialogue.text: They all run after him up the stairs. INT. COCKPIT/ANTONOV - DUSK Sasha enters the cockpit and puts on the headset while readying the plane for takeoff.

segments.content: (into the mic)
You'll find folding seats on each side
of the cargo hold...
... Sit down and buckle up!
They all scramble to get into their seats.
They discover the cargo they are carrying-- Sports cars, SUV's, concept cars and luxury models, some of them are labeled `Las Vegas Auto Show 2012'.

dialogue.text: They discover the cargo they are carrying-- Sports cars, SUV's, concept cars and luxury models, some of them are labeled `Las Vegas Auto Show 2012'.

segments.content: The six engines of the Antonov come roaring to life. INT. COCKPIT/ANTONOV - DUSK The plane is starting to move. Gordon sits uncomfortably in the copilot's seat.

character.name: We had VIP tickets for that.

dialogue.text: The six engines of the Antonov come roaring to life. INT. COCKPIT/ANTONOV - DUSK The plane is starting to move. Gordon sits uncomfortably in the copilot's seat.

segments.content: You check the main bus for the
hydraulics. I'll balance the tanks.
Sasha reaches over and does it himself.

dialogue.text: Sasha reaches over and does it himself.

segments.content: Work the radio and keep an eye on the
fuel, okay?
Gordon nods and puts on the headset, trying to focus.

People start SCREAMING, when they discover the menacing WALL

          OF ASH racing towards them.
EXT. RUNWAY/LAS VEGAS AIRPORT - DUSK The nose of the Antonov turns onto the runway. This humongous plane suddenly looks small against the wall of ash. INT. COCKPIT/ANTONOV - DUSK Gordon is panicking.

character.name: Move back, people... down on the floor!

dialogue.text: EXT. RUNWAY/LAS VEGAS AIRPORT - DUSK The nose of the Antonov turns onto the runway. This humongous plane suddenly looks small against the wall of ash. INT. COCKPIT/ANTONOV - DUSK Gordon is panicking.

segments.content: We have to get going!
Sasha hits the throttle.

A deafening THUNDER emanates from the engines. INT. CARGO HOLD/ANTONOV - DUSK Everybody grabs their seat as the vibration of the aircraft builds. EXT. RUNWAY/LAS VEGAS AIRPORT - DUSK The Antonov steadily gains speed as it rumbles down the cracked and uneven runway. The canyon that has swallowed half the city looms ahead. And behind them the volcanic cloud bears down. INT. COCKPIT/ANTONOV - DUSK Sasha stares down the gap ahead, determined. Gordon's face is as white as a sheet.

dialogue.text: A deafening THUNDER emanates from the engines. INT. CARGO HOLD/ANTONOV - DUSK Everybody grabs their seat as the vibration of the aircraft builds. EXT. RUNWAY/LAS VEGAS AIRPORT - DUSK The Antonov steadily gains speed as it rumbles down the cracked and uneven runway. The canyon that has swallowed half the city looms ahead. And behind them the volcanic cloud bears down. INT. COCKPIT/ANTONOV - DUSK Sasha stares down the gap ahead, determined. Gordon's face is as white as a sheet.

segments.content: We're not gonna make it!

INT. TERMINAL/LAS VEGAS AIRPORT - DUSK The violent cloud has finally reached the airport. The terminals are hit by flying debris. Seconds later, Yuri's Gulfstream is whipped through the air, shattering the huge windows into a thousand pieces. People are thrown like rag dolls as the jet explodes in a massive fireball. INT. CARGO HOLD/ANTONOV - DUSK Kate and Jackson hold their kids tight. Tamara clings to little Caesar and Yuri to his twins.

dialogue.text: INT. TERMINAL/LAS VEGAS AIRPORT - DUSK The violent cloud has finally reached the airport. The terminals are hit by flying debris. Seconds later, Yuri's Gulfstream is whipped through the air, shattering the huge windows into a thousand pieces. People are thrown like rag dolls as the jet explodes in a massive fireball. INT. CARGO HOLD/ANTONOV - DUSK Kate and Jackson hold their kids tight. Tamara clings to little Caesar and Yuri to his twins.

segments.content:
The Antonov lumbers heavily towards the inevitable drop off

          on the horizon. The runway is way too short...

          And to make matters worse, the ground begins to move again,

          slowly arching the tarmac upwards, creating a crooked ramp at

          the end of it.

A drop of sweat trickles down Sasha's forehead as he pulls

          back the wheel.

          Gordon holds on for dear life as the huge plane barely lifts

          off, veering sideways.

The Antonov is on a collision course with the crumbling

          casino towers along the other side of the rim.

Gordon grabs the wheel on his side, helping Sasha pull up the beast of a plane. EXT. CANYON RIM/LAS VEGAS - DUSK Very slowly the plane starts to rise and Sasha's face lights up. They barely make it over a casino called `Paris; Las Vegas'. But the plane clips its wheels on a high metal structure right behind it, ripping away part of the landing gear. INT. COCKPIT/ANTONOV - DUSK After some struggle, Sasha manages to steady the Antonov. Gordon's face is green as he looks back.

dialogue.text: Gordon grabs the wheel on his side, helping Sasha pull up the beast of a plane. EXT. CANYON RIM/LAS VEGAS - DUSK Very slowly the plane starts to rise and Sasha's face lights up. They barely make it over a casino called `Paris; Las Vegas'. But the plane clips its wheels on a high metal structure right behind it, ripping away part of the landing gear. INT. COCKPIT/ANTONOV - DUSK After some struggle, Sasha manages to steady the Antonov. Gordon's face is green as he looks back.

segments.content: Sasha looks over and grins. He grabs the microphone.

dialogue.text: Sasha looks over and grins. He grabs the microphone.

segments.content: Ladies and gentlemen, we are on our way
to China.

An ancient monastery built atop a solitary mountain rock. In

          the distance, the sun glistens off the peaks of the

          Himalayas.

          NENG PANG, a young monk, 20, sits with his superior and

          teacher LAMA YAK LA, 65. They have tea beneath a huge bronze

          bell.
(in Chinese)
Do not believe in anything simply
because you have heard it, Neng.
But Lin is my brother. He is working
inside the big tunnels, where the ships
are made.
The Lama remains silent.
What is in your wisdom for us to do,
great Lama... if Lin is right, if our
world is indeed coming to an end?
Instead of answering, the Lama serves him more tea.
When the cup is full, the Lama doesn't stop pouring. Neng
watches the tea overflow until he can no longer restrain
himself.
It's full, great Lama. It can hold no
more!
The Lama stops pouring and looks at Neng.
Like this cup, Neng, you are full of
your own opinions and speculations. How
can I show you wisdom unless you first
empty your cup?
Neng bows his head in embarrassment.
The Lama smiles to himself and takes a chain from around his
neck. On it hangs a set of rusty car keys.
Be careful with the clutch. It tends to
slide.
The Lama throws him the keys and the young monk catches them,
smiling from ear to ear. They bow to each other and Neng runs
off.
Lama Yak La looks after him as a father would. He gets up and
strikes the bronze bell with a wooden mallet.

As far as you can see is a series of identical little houses.

          The house in the foreground has a chicken coop in the garden.

          Mrs. Pang enters the coop. We last saw her when the village

          was being evacuated. She grabs one of the hens. She places

          its head on a woodblock and picks up a rusty hatchet.

          Just about to strike, she hears a strange RATTLING noise.

          An old truck comes driving towards the house. Behind the

          wheel sits her son Neng. She puts down the hatchet, yelling.
(in Chinese)
The young monk jumps out, quickly bowing.

dialogue.text: The young monk jumps out, quickly bowing.

segments.content: Mother, I got a message from Lin. He
wants us to meet him in Cho Ming, at
the west gate. He says he can get us on
one of the ships he is working on.
Mrs. Pang is still holding the chicken by its throat.
I thought Lin is working on the dam?
The dam is a ship, Mother. The
government lied to us. There will be a
big flood.
The chicken hangs limp in Mrs. Pang's hand.
Not here in the mountains... Let's eat
first.
The hen panics as she puts its head back on the block,
raising the hatchet again.
No mother! We must pack up right away.
We took a trip with the Laem Song ferry
once. Your father was throwing up the
whole way.
The door opens and Mr. Pang appears.
Neng, I did not know you were coming
for dinner.
At that moment the hatchet drops with a THUD!
The majestic Antonov is flying high in the Pacific skies.

INT. CARGO HOLD/ANTONOV - NIGHT The boys are exploring the huge freight deck. Caesar, the little dog, is traipsing along. Alec, Oleg and Noah marvel at a stylish mixture of luxury and performance cars.

dialogue.text: INT. CARGO HOLD/ANTONOV - NIGHT The boys are exploring the huge freight deck. Caesar, the little dog, is traipsing along. Alec, Oleg and Noah marvel at a stylish mixture of luxury and performance cars.

segments.content: Our dad had one on order. We were
supposed to get it next year.
But then he cancelled it again, because
of the ships.
Noah points to a 2012 Aston Martin parked further back.
If I was rich, I'd get one of those.
We have one. How many cars does your
family have?
My Mom's boyfriend has a Porsche, a
Carrera 4.
The boys share a moment of understanding.

dialogue.text: The boys share a moment of understanding.

segments.content: Noah reaches for the door of the Bentley. To his surprise, it opens.

character.name: Nothing we can do about that.

dialogue.text: Noah reaches for the door of the Bentley. To his surprise, it opens.

segments.content: Noah jumps into the car.

dialogue.text: Noah jumps into the car.

segments.content: Kate and Lilly are still belted in next to Tamara. Jackson and Yuri sit on the other side of the Antonov.

dialogue.text: Kate and Lilly are still belted in next to Tamara. Jackson and Yuri sit on the other side of the Antonov.

segments.content: How did you meet Dr. Silberman? He's
great, isn't he?
I think for the same reasons you did.
You know, after breast feeding two
kids...
Kate looks at Tamara.
Did your husband ask you to get your's
done?
We are not married. And we probably
never will... But he paid for them.
They laugh.

dialogue.text: They laugh.

segments.content: What did the man pay for mommy?
Kate looks over at Jackson who's trying to make sense of Charlie's map. Tamara catches her looking.

dialogue.text: Kate looks over at Jackson who's trying to make sense of Charlie's map. Tamara catches her looking.

segments.content: Kate lets out a sigh.

dialogue.text: Kate lets out a sigh.

segments.content: On the other side of the plane, Yuri has been watching the two women talk.

dialogue.text: On the other side of the plane, Yuri has been watching the two women talk.

segments.content: They seem to like each other.
I guess... So tell me Mr. Karpov - how
much did you pay?
One billion euro, per seat.
That's disgusting.
You know Curtis, I wasn't always
businessman. I am a boxer. Was my only
playing when I was a boy, back in
Murmansk. My coach...
